meta.name: The Infinite Explorer with Hannah Fry
meta.description: Professor Hannah Fry sets off on a global adventure, not just to see the world but to decode it. With curiosity, wit and insight she peels back the layers in six iconic locations: Spain, Vietnam, Greece, South Korea, Ireland, and Iceland.Through stunning landscapes, vibrant cities and off the beaten track treasures, Hannah seeks out extraordinary local voices and unexpected quirks of history and geography that reveal what makes each place truly unique. Always seeking patterns and hidden connections, she uncovers how Spain's destiny was shaped by mountains, analyses traffic etiquette in Ho Chi Minh City, reveals secrets hidden in the geometry at the Parthenon and how Irish syntax builds a world view.This is much more than a travelogueâ€”it's a journey into the forces that shape nations and define cultures.

videos.title: Spain
videos.overview: Hannah Fry explores why contradictions are such an integral part of Spanish culture. Travelling across the country, she decodes rhythms in flamenco, seeks out the origins of paella, learns an ancient whistling language and indulges her love of urban planning.

videos.title: South Korea
videos.overview: Hannah Fry visits South Korea to explore how it became a cultural and technological superpower. She trains with a Taekwondo blackbelt, learns the secrets of kimchi from a grandmaster, and dives into the world of pro-gamin,; all to uncover how this small nation turned hardship into strength, blending tradition with a bold new sense of identity.

videos.title: Greece
videos.overview: Hannah Fry journeys across islands, mountains and olive groves to reveal why ancient Greece was the birthplace of so many big ideas. She decodes the Parthenon's geometry, sails the Aegean with ancient tools, tries her hand at olive farming and is swept up in a riotous flour-throwing festival that blends ancient myth with modern identity.

videos.title: Ireland
videos.overview: Ireland doesn't take up much room on the map, but few places have an identity so celebrated across the world. Hannah Fry journeys to her ancestral homeland to discover what it means to be Irish. She traces her Irish DNA, rides the waves of a surf boom, explores connections to the land at the races and reveals hidden depths in the Irish language.

videos.title: Iceland
videos.overview: Hannah Fry visits Iceland to uncover the secrets behind its success. She meets scientists predicting lava flows, sees how geothermal power fuels an algae farm, explores Icelandic DNA and rides horseback through ancient Viking landscapes - all to reveal how a tiny, isolated island, shaped by geological extremes, is thriving against the odds.

videos.title: Vietnam
videos.overview: Hannah explores Vietnam's remarkable post-war transformation, from moped chaos in Ho Chi Minh City to the muddy graft of prawn harvest in the Mekong Delta.
